keyPolicies.policyDescription: Emphasizes the importance of independent shops and local businesses receiving all the help they can get, as opposed to large supermarkets.

issues.economy: With Britain still facing difficult times, it's essential that our independent shops and local businesses receive all the help they can get. Labour's record includes leaving our economy in tatters.
issues.education: Labour's record includes the highest truancy rate in the country under their governance.
issues.governance: Labour's record: Broke their 1997 manifesto promise not to introduce tuition fees. Hiding the truth about their illegal Iraq war. Labour's unfair Police funding formula has denied Manchester of Â£82 million to fight crime.
issues.health: John was part of the campaign to recoup the money that The Christie lost during the Icelandic banking collapse.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet criticizes Labour's past record on various governance issues, notably the introduction of tuition fees, the handling of the Iraq war, and local police funding.
